data.title: Great coffee shop in downtown RVA!
data.text: I came here for coffee with a colleague. I recently started working at a nearby office and this was my first visit to Sefton Coffee. I ordered the cinnamon vanilla latte and it was amazing! Everything on their menu, including their happy hour features look fantastic. I'm so excited my colleague introduced me to Sefton Coffee because I will definitely be back!

data.title: Best coffee shop in VA (not just Richmond!)
data.text: Amazing coffee! A lot of options and varieties but my favorite is the honey and spice latte. I crave this drink on a regular. The chicken salad sandwich is delicious! The oatmeal is also another great option if you stop in in the morning. The coffee shop is cozy and comfortable! The staff is phenomenal! I have absolutely no complaints about this place, it is my favorite! I've brought several friends to try it out and every single one of them have become a regular customer here and love it. MUST TRY! and you won't ever turn back!

data.title: Very quaint with great coffee
data.text: Sefton is a hidden gem in a part of town that doesn't have many coffee options.  It's very quaint and charming inside, and the service is friendly and helpful.  There are numerous by-the-pound coffee options and the coffee served any given day is always wonderful.  The pastries are decent, too, and I've heard great things about the chicken salad and other food items, but I haven't tried them yet.  Stop by and support a great local business!

data.title: Best coffee (pastries, and chicken salad) in Richmond!
data.text: I love the honey & spice latte. The best coffee I've ever had... I crave this drink on a daily basis. It's always made perfect, strong & a little sweet! Such a cool vinatge shop, and they have pastries and amazing chicken salad! I walk over to this coffee shop about 4 times a week and it's worth every bit!

data.title: A strong 3.7 stars
data.text:
Couldn't decide on what to rate them. It's more like a strong 3.7 stars, so I rounded it up to a 4 :)
Hmm let's see. It's in downtown Richmond (around Virginia State Capitol, Secretary of the Commonwealth and so on) so the place was packed with people in suits trying to get their caffeine fix so I guess that's a good sign, right? 
Even though it's somehow down the street from all the busyness, I appreciated their signage outside. Made it easier to find them. 
The place is super cute with chalkboard signs about their coffee types as well as a great variety of drinks with delicious names. There were two people working and the cashier guy must have been having a bad day because I tried to have small talk and he just kind of shrugged me off. The girl preparing the drinks was friendly. They have ample seating for groups or solo coffee drinking :)
I ordered a ginger matcha green tea frappe and it took a while to prepare (2-3 people who ordered after me got their drinks before me). My drink tastes like its name - it had matcha green tea, ginger and crushed ice in it. It was refreshing on a warm day, but it wasn't worth the $5 something I was charged for it.

data.title: Very nice
data.text: Had coffee here with business folks.  Fantastic staff, really good coffee, great selections.  You could pass by not and not notice it.  But trust us, it is worth stopping in and supporting local business!

data.title: Nice quaint coffee shop
data.text: Nice atmosphere, good coffee, and interesting selection of healthy items. It's small but the service was good. It was a good spot for a light breakfast.

data.title: Lovely coffee shop
data.text: Extensive menu for coffee and drinks. Try the affogato. Everything, including coffee, is better with icecream :)

data.title: Great place for quick breakfast and lunch
data.text: After finding out about and visiting Sefton, I make it a point to visit 2-3 times a week for coffee and light fare. The coffee and drinks reasonably priced. The lunch sandwiches are unfortunately pre-made and don't offer a lot of custom options. The ABC sandwich (Apple, bacon, and cheddar on pumpernickel) is very decent. The options of trail mix that accompany the sandwich are awesome. The staff is kind and cheerful. This is my favorite coffee shop in all of Richmond.

data.title: Great find for coffee, sandwiches, conversation...
data.text: Other review sites led me to this somewhat inconspicuous coffee shop not far from the Capitol complex and Supreme Court. I met a friend for lunch and coffee during a business trip. The comfortable, casual decor was inviting and the people were very friendly. My chicken tarragon sandwich was very good, with a choice from various trail mixes as the side. The coffee drink (latte) was excellent, and there were many other hot and cold beverages on the menu that I'd love to try. I've seen great reviews of their take-home coffee beans but haven't gotten to try them. I'm glad to have discovered Sefton Coffee and will gladly return when I'm in the neighborhood.
